sense.name: cause death, be fatal
sense.commentary: Includes: KILL OFF, KILL ONESELF (in the sense of suicide)
sense.examples: This man killed several people when he tried to rob a bank. She was killed in the collision of three cars. Cigarettes kill. Drunken driving kills. AIDS has killed thousands in Africa. We killed off all the coyotes, wolves, cougars, and bears that preyed on white tailed deer.

sense.name: cause great pain or anguish
sense.commentary: Note: can be "self-inflicted torment"--compare to KILL ONESELF in senses 1 and 6 Note: compare with sense 5 ambiguous examples
sense.examples: These new shoes are killing me! The daily stress of her work is killing her. I am killing myself for not figuring this out earlier.

sense.name: eliminate
sense.examples: To kill poverty, the poor countries themselves must get their house in order. Kill these lines in the President's speech. Eating artichokes kills the taste of all other foods.

sense.name: thwart
sense.examples: The conference killed the proposal for limited formal discovery in criminal proceedings. The City Council has killed an attempt to set a spending limit for local elections. City Council members also killed a motion that would have banned unleashed dogs in any public park.

sense.name: overwhelm
sense.commentary: Note: compare example 2 with sense 2 (pain and anguish); Example 2 is ambiguous in reference to the overwhelming sensation (could be interpreted as awe or emotional distress); ambiguous examples should be tagged with this sense
sense.examples: The comedian was so funny, he was killing me! It just kills me to watch the emergency vets on animal planet. He's killing me softly with his song.

sense.name: to strain oneself to the limit
sense.commentary: Includes: KILL ONESELF (*not* with the sense of suicide)
sense.examples: It seemed like I was killing myself for a losing program and I was considering leaving myself. I'm killing myself for your love and again all is lost. She is still killing herself over the next project, and she still looks great.

sense.name: cease operation of
sense.examples: The the wind came back and we killed the engine. They killed the lights and they killed the music. They had killed the battery to the point where they had to jump start the car.

sense.name: hit with great force
sense.examples: She killed the ball. He killed the ball from the back court causing the side out in our favor.

sense.name: drink down
sense.examples: She killed a bottle of brandy that night. I killed a glass of La Trappe Tripel, and then I killed a half-liter of wheat beer goodness.
